head.supplied: 20 July 1860 ¶ ¶ [With reference to the a/c for seeds to Henderson & Co, London — Doctor M. thinks it shd be paid out of votes for P. Works Dept.]...

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; text-align: end; color: #0000ff;

div.p: See fn 2: The note is singularly un-informative as it stands. Was the account charged to the BG, or to PW?
No. 6389, vol. 1860 P, VPRS 1168/P inward correspondence registers, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office, Victoria.

Letter not found.
On 9 July 1860 the Under Treasurer, E. Symonds, forwarded to Nicholson for completion an account to reimburse the botanical agent for payment made to Henderson & Co. The account was referred to M on 1 August annotated: 'the a/c to be pd fr [from] vote of curt [currrent] year &c.' (No. 5888, vol. 1860 P, VPRS 1168/P, PROV). 20 July 1860

[With reference to the a/c for seeds to Henderson & Co, London — Doctor M. thinks it shd be paid out of votes for P. Works Dept.]
On 2 August 1860 Symonds wrote again to Nicholson, fowarding for completion and quotation of authority an account for £26.11.9 being payment to Henderson & Co for seeds. The letter was referred back to the Treasurer on 14 August annotated: 'see min on P6389' (No. 6805, vol. 1860 Q, VPRS 1168/P, PROV).
